title: Gully Pot Inspection and Road Hierarchy Data

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I wish to request for gully inspection data (Jan 2017 to December 2021) and road hierarchy data within your council.
For Gully Inspection Data:
During inspection and cleansing, silt levels in highways gully pots are measured and/or recorded. For example, an inspected gully pot can be 0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, or 100% filled with silt. Local authorities store these inspection records in a spreadsheet. I therefore wish to request for your silt level data from January 2017 to December 2021
For Road Hierarchy Data:
In the UK, local authority roads are classed as rural and urban and further reclassified based on hierarchy (or categories) such as motorway, strategic route, main distributor roads, secondary distributor, local distributor etc. For example: Page 33 of South Gloucestershire's Asset Management Framework document (Highways-Asset-Management-Framework2015-2020.pdf (southglos.gov.uk)) shows an example of a local authority's road hierarchy (categories). I will need this for all roads in your council.
Yours faithfully,
Francis E

Dear Francis Ekechukwu
Thank you for your request for information relating to Gully Pot
Inspection and Road Hierarchy Data, which we received on 29/07/2023.
We confirm we hold some of the information you have requested.
Please find our response below:
For Gully Inspection Data:
During inspection and cleansing, silt levels in highways gully pots are
measured and/or recorded. For example, an inspected gully pot can be 0%,
25%, 50%, 75%, or 100% filled with silt. Local authorities store these
inspection records in a spreadsheet. I therefore wish to request for your
silt level data from January 2017 to December 2021
Please see attached spreadsheet which identifies silt levels recorded in
highways gully pots.
This data was recorded during inspections completed between 1 January 2017
and 31 December 2021 (separate years split across the tabs) and
identifies:-
• GUEM = Empty
• GU25 = 25% full
• GU50 = 50% full
• GU75 = 75% full
• GUFU = 100% full
Records have been included where the silt level data was not recorded
during the inspection.
For Road Hierarchy Data:
In the UK, local authority roads are classed as rural and urban and
further reclassified based on hierarchy (or categories) such as motorway,
strategic route, main distributor roads, secondary distributor, local
distributor etc. For example: Page 33 of South Gloucestershire's Asset
Management Framework document
(Highways-Asset-Management-Framework2015-2020.pdf (southglos.gov.uk))
shows an example of a local authority's road hierarchy (categories). I
will need this for all roads in your council.
We are not aware of any national guidelines that requires Councils to
categorise highways in the manner that South Gloucestershire have and we
are  unable to provide data with those attributes.
However, we do have information relating to strategic routes, primary
routes and HGV approved routes and details of these are attached.
A list of classified roads and a full list of highways maintained by
Sheffield City Council can found at [1]Highway records | Sheffield City
Council
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
